oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Horse Ferry is Relic of By-Gone Days
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cheney, Brainerd
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space
Work
African Americans -- Employment
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The article mentions that modern bridge will soon end duties of the horse-drawn ferry. In fact, after John Downs retired, Jim Daughtrey (1930-32) and Lee Downs(1932-42) ran the ferry, which was motorized in 1936. The last crossing took place 15 July 1954.
